titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C15

body.ab: <lb n="c56-0108__main__1"/> <milestone spanTo="#c56-0108.08" unit="tei:head"/> Chap. 13th <lb n="c56-0108__main__2"/> Nothing is more painful <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>than when the <lb n="c56-0108__main__3"/> mind has been worked up by a quick <lb n="c56-0108__main__4"/> <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e19853__Start"/> S <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e19853__End"/> succession of events, for a dead calm <lb n="c56-0108__main__5"/> of inaction and certainty to <lb n="c56-0108__left_margin__1"/> of inaction & certainty <lb n="c56-0108__left_margin__2"/> <milestone spanTo="#c56-0108.09" unit="tei:seg" xml:id="c56-0108.07"/> the dead calmness<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>which follows <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e19885__Start"/> which <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e19885__End"/> and <lb n="c56-0108__main__6"/> deprives the <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e19897__Start"/> mind <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e19897__End"/> soul both of hope or fear. <lb n="c56-0108__main__7"/> Justine died— She rested. <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e19908__Start"/> But <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e19908__End"/> & I was alive <lb n="c56-0108__main__8"/> the blood flowed freely in my veins but <lb n="c56-0108__main__9"/> a weight of despair & remorse pressed <lb n="c56-0108__main__10"/> on my heart which nothing could remove– <lb n="c56-0108__main__11"/> our house was a house of mourning– <lb n="c56-0108__main__12"/> My fathers health was deeply shaken by <lb n="c56-0108__main__13"/> the horror of the recent events; Eliza <lb n="c56-0108__main__14"/> beth was sad and desponding– She no longer <lb n="c56-0108__main__15"/> took delight in her ordinary occupa <lb n="c56-0108__main__16"/> tions all pleasure seemed to her sacri <lb n="c56-0108__main__17"/> ledge towards the dead— eternal woe <lb n="c56-0108__main__18"/> and tears she then thought was the <lb n="c56-0108__main__19"/> just tribute she ought to pay to inno <lb n="c56-0108__main__20"/> cence thus blasted & <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e19963__Start"/> destroyed <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e19963__End"/> Sleep fled <lb n="c56-0108__main__21"/> from my eyes. I wandered like an <lb n="c56-0108__main__22"/> evil spirit for I <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e19977__Start"/> done <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e19977__End"/> <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>had committed deeds of mischief beyond <lb n="c56-0108__main__23"/> description <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>horrible, and <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20000__Start"/> hor <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20000__End"/> more much more (I <lb n="c56-0108__main__24"/> persuaded my self) was yet in store. <lb n="c56-0108__main__25"/> Yet my heart overflowed with kind <lb n="c56-0108__main__26"/> ness and <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20017__Start"/> benevolence <del loc="c56-0108__main__d1e20017__End"/> goodness – I had begun life <lb n="c56-0108__main__27"/> with benevolent intentions and thirsted for <lb n="c56-0108__main__28"/> the moment when I <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>could put them in practise <lb n="c56-0109__main__1"/> and make myself useful to my fellow <lb n="c56-0109__main__2"/> beings. <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20048__Start"/> But <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20048__End"/> Now all was blasted; Instead <lb n="c56-0109__main__3"/> of serenity of conscience which allowed me <lb n="c56-0109__main__4"/> to look back on my actions with self satis <lb n="c56-0109__main__5"/> faction, and from thence <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>to gather promise of new hopes like <lb n="c56-0109__main__6"/> gay-sweet-smelling flowers to spring up <lb n="c56-0109__main__7"/> with regard to futurity. I was seized by <lb n="c56-0109__main__8"/> remorse and guilt, and hurried away <lb n="c56-0109__main__9"/> to a hell <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20112__Start"/> no tongue <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20112__End"/> of intense tortures such as no language can <lb n="c56-0109__main__10"/> describe. <milestone unit="tei:p"/> <lb n="c56-0109__main__11"/> This state of mind <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20128__Start"/> allt <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20128__End"/> <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20131__Start"/> altered <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20131__End"/> preyed upon my health <lb n="c56-0109__main__12"/> which had <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20142__Start"/> nearly <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20142__End"/> entirely recovered from the <lb n="c56-0109__main__13"/> first shock it had sustained. I shunned <lb n="c56-0109__main__14"/> the face of man; all sound of joy or <lb n="c56-0109__main__15"/> complacency was torture to me; Solitude <lb n="c56-0109__main__16"/> was my only consolation deep, dark, <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20161__Start"/> night <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20161__End"/> <lb n="c56-0109__main__17"/> death-like solitude. My father observed <lb n="c56-0109__main__18"/> with pain <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20171__Start"/> how <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20171__End"/> the alteration perceptible in my dispositions & habits, <lb n="c56-0109__main__19"/> <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20179__Start"/> were altered <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20179__End"/> and endeavoured to reason <lb n="c56-0109__main__20"/> with me on the folly of giving way to immo <lb n="c56-0109__main__21"/> derate grief. "Do you think, Victor" said he <lb n="c56-0109__main__22"/> "That I do not suffer also– no one <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>could love <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20203__Start"/> d <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20203__End"/> <lb n="c56-0109__main__23"/> a child more than I <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20211__Start"/> did <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20211__End"/> loved your brother– <lb n="c56-0109__main__24"/> ( <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20220__Start"/> and <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20220__End"/> tears came <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20223__Start"/> into <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20223__End"/> into his eyes as he <lb n="c56-0109__main__25"/> said this) but is it not <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20234__Start"/> our <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20234__End"/> a duty not to <lb n="c56-0109__main__26"/> add to the grief of <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20247__Start"/> owed <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20247__End"/> to the <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20250__Start"/> ir <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20250__End"/> survivors <lb n="c56-0109__main__27"/> <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20257__Start"/> not <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20257__End"/> <metamark function="insert">^</metamark> <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20264__Start"/> add to <del loc="c56-0109__main__d1e20264__End"/> <lb n="c56-0109__left_margin__1"/> that we <lb n="c56-0109__left_margin__2"/> should re <lb n="c56-0109__left_margin__3"/> frain from <lb n="c56-0109__left_margin__4"/> <del loc="c56-0109__left_margin__d1e20283__Start"/> adding to <del loc="c56-0109__left_margin__d1e20283__End"/> <lb n="c56-0109__left_margin__5"/> augmenting their unhappiness by an appear <lb n="c56-0109__main__28"/> ance of immoderate grief. It is also a duty <lb n="c56-0109__main__29"/> owed to yourself; for excessive sorrow <lb n="c56-0109__main__30"/> prevents improvement or enjoyment, or <lb n="c56-0109__main__31"/> even the discharge of dayly usefullness <lb n="c56-0109__main__32"/> without which no man is fit for <lb n="c56-0110__main__1"/> society." <milestone unit="tei:p"/> <lb n="c56-0110__main__2"/> This advice, although good, was utterly inna <lb n="c56-0110__main__3"/> plicable to my case; I should have been <lb n="c56-0110__main__4"/> the first to hide my grief and console <lb n="c56-0110__main__5"/> my friends if remorse had not mingled its <lb n="c56-0110__main__6"/> bitterness with my other sensations. Now <lb n="c56-0110__main__7"/> I could only answer my father with a <lb n="c56-0110__main__8"/> look of despair and endeavour to <lb n="c56-0110__main__9"/> hide myself from his view. About this <lb n="c56-0110__main__10"/> time <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20343__Start"/> also <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20343__End"/> we retired to our house at <lb n="c56-0110__main__11"/> Belrive. This <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20348__Start"/> chal <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20348__End"/> change was very <lb n="c56-0110__main__12"/> agreable to me in particular. The <lb n="c56-0110__main__13"/> shutting of the gates of the town regularly <lb n="c56-0110__main__14"/> at ten o'clock and the impossibility of <lb n="c56-0110__main__15"/> <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20361__Start"/> stay <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20361__End"/> <metamark function="insert">^</metamark> <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20368__Start"/> ing <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20368__End"/> <lb n="c56-0110__left_margin__1"/> remaining on the lake after that hour <lb n="c56-0110__main__16"/> rendered our residence within the <lb n="c56-0110__main__17"/> walls of Geneva very irksome to me. <lb n="c56-0110__main__18"/> I was now free: often, after the rest of <lb n="c56-0110__main__19"/> the family had retired for the night <lb n="c56-0110__main__20"/> I took the boat and passed the <lb n="c56-0110__main__21"/> night upon the water: sometimes <lb n="c56-0110__main__22"/> with my sails set I was carried by the <lb n="c56-0110__main__23"/> wind and sometimes after <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20398__Start"/> wo <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20398__End"/> rowing <lb n="c56-0110__main__24"/> into the middle of the lake I left the <lb n="c56-0110__main__25"/> boat to <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20407__Start"/> take <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20407__End"/> <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>pursue its own course and <lb n="c56-0110__main__26"/> <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20421__Start"/> followed <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20421__End"/> <metamark function="insert">^</metamark> <lb n="c56-0110__left_margin__1"/> gave way to my own miserable reflections. <lb n="c56-0110__main__27"/> I was often tempted <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20442__Start"/> w <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20442__End"/> when all was <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20447__Start"/> quiet <del loc="c56-0110__main__d1e20447__End"/> <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>at peace <lb n="c56-0110__main__28"/> around me and I the only unquiet <lb n="c56-0110__main__29"/> thing that wandered restless in a scene <lb n="c56-0111__main__1"/> so beautiful & heavenly; if I except <lb n="c56-0111__main__2"/> alone some bat, or the<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>frogs, whose harsh and <lb n="c56-0111__main__3"/> interrupted croaking <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20487__Start"/> of the frogs <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20487__End"/> <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20491__Start"/> which <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20491__End"/> was <lb n="c56-0111__main__4"/> <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20499__Start"/> I <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20499__End"/> heard only when I approached the <lb n="c56-0111__main__5"/> shore; often I say, I was tempted to <lb n="c56-0111__main__6"/> plunge into the <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20510__Start"/> still and <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20510__End"/> silent lake <lb n="c56-0111__main__7"/> <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20516__Start"/> and let <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20516__End"/> that the waters<metamark function="insert">>^</metamark>might close over me & <lb n="c56-0111__main__8"/> my calamities for ever. But I was <lb n="c56-0111__main__9"/> restrained when I thought of the heroic <lb n="c56-0111__main__10"/> &suffering Elizabeth whom I tenderly <lb n="c56-0111__main__11"/> loved, and whose existence was bound <lb n="c56-0111__main__12"/> up in mine. And then I thought also <lb n="c56-0111__main__13"/> of my father and surviving brother; <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20548__Start"/> And <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20548__End"/> <lb n="c56-0111__main__14"/> should I not by my base desertion leave <lb n="c56-0111__main__15"/> them exposed & unprotected to the <lb n="c56-0111__main__16"/> malice of the fiend <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20564__Start"/> I <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20564__End"/> whom I had <lb n="c56-0111__main__17"/> let lose among them? At these <lb n="c56-0111__main__18"/> moments I wept bitterly and wished <lb n="c56-0111__main__19"/> that peace would revisit my mind <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0111.02">^</metamark> <lb n="c56-0111__left_margin__1"/> <del loc="c56-0111__left_margin__d1e20581__Start"/> if <del loc="c56-0111__left_margin__d1e20581__End"/> only — <lb n="c56-0111__main__20"/> that I might afford them consolation <lb n="c56-0111__main__21"/> and happiness — but that could not <lb n="c56-0111__main__22"/> be: remorse <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20594__Start"/> took away <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20594__End"/> extinguished every hope— <lb n="c56-0111__main__23"/> I had been the <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20605__Start"/> cause <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20605__End"/> author of unalterable <lb n="c56-0111__main__24"/> evil, and I lived in daily fear that <lb n="c56-0111__main__25"/> the dæmonof some new wickedness <lb n="c56-0111__main__26"/> whichlet the monster whom I had <lb n="c56-0111__main__27"/> created might <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20635__Start"/> commit <del loc="c56-0111__main__d1e20635__End"/> perpetratesome new wickedness. –I had anobscure feeling <lb n="c56-0111__main__28"/> that all was not over, and that <lb n="c56-0111__main__29"/> he would still commit some signal <lb n="c56-0112__main__1"/> <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e20664__Start"/> cr <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e20664__End"/> crime which by its enormity would <lb n="c56-0112__main__2"/> <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__1"/> almost efface the recollection of the past. <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0112.02">X</metamark> <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__1"/> <metamark function="displacement">X</metamark>There was <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__2"/> always scope <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__3"/> for fear so <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__4"/> long as any <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__5"/> thing that <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__6"/> I loved remained <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__7"/> alive. My <lb n="c56-0112__main__3"/> abhorrence of this fiend cannot be <lb n="c56-0112__main__4"/> conceived – When I thought of him I <lb n="c56-0112__main__5"/> gnashed my teeth my eyes became inflam <lb n="c56-0112__main__6"/> ed and I ardently wished to extinguish <lb n="c56-0112__main__7"/> that life which I had so thoughtlessly <lb n="c56-0112__main__8"/> bestowed. When I <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e20719__Start"/> though <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e20719__End"/> reflected on his <lb n="c56-0112__main__9"/> crimes and malice, my hatred and <lb n="c56-0112__main__10"/> revenge burst all bounds of moderation <lb n="c56-0112__main__11"/> I wished but to see him again that I <lb n="c56-0112__main__12"/> might I would have made a pilgrimage <lb n="c56-0112__main__13"/> to the highestpeak of the Andes could I when there <lb n="c56-0112__main__14"/> have precipitated him to their <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e20743__Start"/> foot <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e20743__End"/> base; I <lb n="c56-0112__main__15"/> wished but to see him again that <lb n="c56-0112__main__16"/> I might wreak the utmost extent of <lb n="c56-0112__main__17"/> anger on his head and avenge the <lb n="c56-0112__main__18"/> deaths of William and Justine. <milestone unit="tei:p"/> <lb n="c56-0112__main__19"/> Our house was <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e20764__Start"/> now <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e20764__End"/> the house <lb n="c56-0112__main__20"/> of mourning, my father's health was deeply <lb n="c56-0112__main__21"/> shaken by the horror of the recent <lb n="c56-0112__main__22"/> events. Elizabeth was sad and desponding <lb n="c56-0112__main__23"/> she no longer took delight in her <lb n="c56-0112__main__24"/> ordinary occupations; all pleasure seemed <lb n="c56-0112__main__25"/> to her sacriledge towards the dead; eter <lb n="c56-0112__left_margin__1"/> <metamark>=</metamark>nal <lb n="c56-0112__main__26"/> woe and tears she then thought was the <lb n="c56-0112__main__27"/> just tribute she should pay to innocence <lb n="c56-0112__main__28"/> so blasted and destroyed. She was no longer <lb n="c56-0112__main__29"/> that happy creature <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e20804__Start"/> she had been when <del loc="c56-0112__main__d1e20804__End"/> <lb n="c56-0113__main__1"/> <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20812__Start"/> last saw her <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20812__End"/> <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__1"/> who in earlier <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__2"/> youth had <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20825__Start"/> – <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20829__Start"/> who <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20829__End"/> had <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20825__End"/> wandered with <lb n="c56-0113__main__2"/> <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20837__Start"/> on <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20837__End"/> me on the banks of the lake <lb n="c56-0113__main__3"/> and talked with extacy of our future <lb n="c56-0113__main__4"/> prospects– She <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20847__Start"/> was <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20847__End"/> had become grave, and often <lb n="c56-0113__main__5"/> <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20857__Start"/> talked <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20857__End"/> <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__1"/> conversed of the inconstancy of fortune <lb n="c56-0113__main__6"/> and the instability of human life— <lb n="c56-0113__main__7"/> "When I reflect, my dear Cousin," she said "on <lb n="c56-0113__main__8"/> the miserable death of Justine Moritz, I <lb n="c56-0113__main__9"/> no longer see <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20877__Start"/> things <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20877__End"/> the world and its <lb n="c56-0113__main__10"/> works in the same light as they before <lb n="c56-0113__main__11"/> appeared to <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>me. Before – <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20897__Start"/> Stories <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20897__End"/> I looked upon the accounts of vice <lb n="c56-0113__main__12"/> and injustice that I read in books or heard <lb n="c56-0113__main__13"/> from others as tales of ancient days or <lb n="c56-0113__main__14"/> imaginary evils;<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0113.06">X</metamark> <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__1"/> <metamark function="displacement">X</metamark>At least they <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__2"/> were remote, <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__3"/> and more <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__4"/> familiar to the <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__5"/> beli reason than <lb n="c56-0113__left_margin__6"/> to imagination but now misery has <lb n="c56-0113__main__15"/> come home and men appear to me as <lb n="c56-0113__main__16"/> monsters thirsting for each others blood. <lb n="c56-0113__main__17"/> Yet I am certainly unjust.–Every one <lb n="c56-0113__main__18"/> believed that poor girl to be guilty, and <lb n="c56-0113__main__19"/> if she <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20957__Start"/> had <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20957__End"/> <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>could have committed the crime for which she suffered, assuredly she would <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20969__Start"/> she not <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20969__End"/> have been <lb n="c56-0113__main__20"/> the most depraved of <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>human creatures. For the <lb n="c56-0113__main__21"/> sake of a few jewels to have murdered <lb n="c56-0113__main__22"/> the son of her benefactor & friend, a child <lb n="c56-0113__main__23"/> whom she had nursed from its birth <lb n="c56-0113__main__24"/> and appeared to love as if it had been <lb n="c56-0113__main__25"/> <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20994__Start"/> its <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e20994__End"/> her own. I could not consent to the <lb n="c56-0113__main__26"/> death of any human being <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21001__Start"/> yet <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21001__End"/> but certainly <lb n="c56-0113__main__27"/> I should have thought such a <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21011__Start"/> woman <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21011__End"/> being <lb n="c56-0113__main__28"/> <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21017__Start"/> unworthy of life <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21017__End"/> <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21021__Start"/> as <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21021__End"/> unfit to remain in the society of men. – Yet she <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21026__Start"/> she <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21026__End"/> was inno <lb n="c56-0113__main__29"/> cent–I know <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21036__Start"/> – <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21036__End"/> I feel she was innocent You <lb n="c56-0113__main__30"/> are of the same opinion and that <lb n="c56-0113__main__31"/> confirms me. Alas, Victor! when <metamark function="insert">^</metamark> <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21050__Start"/> lies <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21050__End"/> <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21053__Start"/> appear <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21053__End"/> falsehood <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21058__Start"/> look <del loc="c56-0113__main__d1e21058__End"/> <lb n="c56-0114__main__1"/> <lb n="c56-0114__left_margin__1"/> can look so like the truth, who can assure them <lb n="c56-0114__main__2"/> selves of certain happiness? I feel as if I <lb n="c56-0114__main__3"/> were walking on the edge of precipiece <lb n="c56-0114__main__4"/> towards which thousands are crowding & <lb n="c56-0114__main__5"/> endeavouring to plunge me into the <lb n="c56-0114__main__6"/> abyss.– William & Justine were assassi <lb n="c56-0114__main__7"/> nated and the murderer escapes, wearing <lb n="c56-0114__main__8"/> human lineaments; he walks about <lb n="c56-0114__main__9"/> the world free & perhaps respected. <lb n="c56-0114__main__10"/> But <del loc="c56-0114__main__d1e21113__Start"/> if <del loc="c56-0114__main__d1e21113__End"/> even if <del loc="c56-0114__main__d1e21117__Start"/> tomo <del loc="c56-0114__main__d1e21117__End"/> I were condemmed <lb n="c56-0114__main__11"/> to suffer on the scaffold for the same <lb n="c56-0114__main__12"/> crimes I would not change places with <lb n="c56-0114__main__13"/> such a wretch." <milestone unit="tei:p"/> <lb n="c56-0114__main__14"/> I listened to this discourse with the <lb n="c56-0114__main__15"/> extremest agony – I – not <del loc="c56-0114__main__d1e21135__Start"/> ind <del loc="c56-0114__main__d1e21135__End"/> <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>in deed <lb n="c56-0114__main__16"/> but in effect was the true murderer.— <lb n="c56-0114__main__17"/> Elizabeth read my anguish in my counte <lb n="c56-0114__main__18"/> nance, and kindly taking my hand <lb n="c56-0114__main__19"/> said–"My dearest cousin, you must <lb n="c56-0114__main__20"/> calm yourself; these events have affect <lb n="c56-0114__main__21"/> ed me God knows how deeply! but I am <lb n="c56-0114__main__22"/> not so wretched as you are. There is an <lb n="c56-0114__main__23"/> expression of misery and sometimes of <lb n="c56-0114__main__24"/> revenge in your countenance that <lb n="c56-0114__main__25"/> makes me tremble; be calm, my <del loc="c56-0114__main__d1e21182__Start"/> beloved <del loc="c56-0114__main__d1e21182__End"/> <metamark function="insert">^</metamark> <del loc="c56-0114__main__d1e21190__Start"/> best <del loc="c56-0114__main__d1e21190__End"/> <lb n="c56-0114__main__26"/> Victor, I would sacrifice my life to your <lb n="c56-0114__main__27"/> peace. We surely shall be happy; <del loc="c56-0114__main__d1e21207__Start"/> quite <del loc="c56-0114__main__d1e21207__End"/> <lb n="c56-0114__main__28"/> quiet in our native country and not <lb n="c56-0115__main__1"/> mingling in the world what can dis <lb n="c56-0115__main__2"/> turb our tranquillity?" <milestone unit="tei:p"/> <lb n="c56-0115__main__3"/> She shed tears as she said this <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0115.01">^</metamark> <lb n="c56-0115__left_margin__1"/> distrusting the <lb n="c56-0115__left_margin__2"/> very solace <lb n="c56-0115__left_margin__3"/> which she <lb n="c56-0115__left_margin__4"/> gave, <lb n="c56-0115__main__4"/> <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21247__Start"/> but <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21247__End"/> but at the same time smiled, that <lb n="c56-0115__main__5"/> she might chase away the fiend that <lb n="c56-0115__main__6"/> lurked in my heart. My father who saw <lb n="c56-0115__main__7"/> in the unhappiness that was painted in <lb n="c56-0115__main__8"/> my face, only an exaggeration of that <lb n="c56-0115__main__9"/> <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21268__Start"/> w <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21268__End"/> sorrow which I might naturally <lb n="c56-0115__main__10"/> feel thought that an amusement <lb n="c56-0115__main__11"/> suited to my taste would be the best <lb n="c56-0115__main__12"/> means of restoring to me my wonted <lb n="c56-0115__main__13"/> serenity – It was <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21280__Start"/> th <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21280__End"/> from this cause that <lb n="c56-0115__main__14"/> he <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21292__Start"/> a <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21292__End"/> had removed to the country & <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21297__Start"/> from <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21297__End"/> <lb n="c56-0115__left_margin__1"/> induced by <lb n="c56-0115__main__15"/> the same reasons he now proposed <lb n="c56-0115__main__16"/> that <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21312__Start"/> I <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21312__End"/> we should all <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21316__Start"/> tak <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21316__End"/> take a <lb n="c56-0115__main__17"/> journey to the Valley of C<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>hamounix. I had <lb n="c56-0115__main__18"/> been there before but Elizabeth & Ernest <lb n="c56-0115__main__19"/> never had, and both had often ex <lb n="c56-0115__main__20"/> pressed a wish to see this place which <lb n="c56-0115__main__21"/> had been described to them as so wonderful <lb n="c56-0115__main__22"/> & sublime. Accordingly we departed from <lb n="c56-0115__main__23"/> Geneva on this tour about the middle <lb n="c56-0115__main__24"/> of the month of august <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21351__Start"/> more <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21351__End"/> <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21354__Start"/> than <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21354__End"/> nearly <lb n="c56-0115__main__25"/> two months after the death of Justine. <milestone unit="tei:p"/> <lb n="c56-0115__main__26"/> The weather was beautiful and if <lb n="c56-0115__main__27"/> mine <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21366__Start"/> d <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21366__End"/> had been a sorrow to be chased <lb n="c56-0115__main__28"/> away by any fleeting circumstance this <lb n="c56-0115__main__29"/> voyage would certainly have had the <lb n="c56-0115__main__30"/> effect <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21377__Start"/> which <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21377__End"/> intended by my father <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21384__Start"/> intended <del loc="c56-0115__main__d1e21384__End"/> . As it <lb n="c56-0116__main__1"/> was I wassomewhat interrested <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21401__Start"/> and sometimes <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21401__End"/> in the scene..it sometimes <lb n="c56-0116__main__2"/> <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21408__Start"/> amused <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21410__Start"/> . <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21410__End"/> <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21408__End"/> <lb n="c56-0116__left_margin__1"/> lulled, it <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21422__Start"/> somehow <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21422__End"/> could not extinguish my grief.duringThe first day we travelled <lb n="c56-0116__main__3"/> in a carriage. In the morning we <lb n="c56-0116__main__4"/> had seen the mountains at a distance <lb n="c56-0116__main__5"/> to which we gradually advanced. <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21437__Start"/> Br <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21437__End"/> <lb n="c56-0116__main__6"/> We perceived that the valley through <lb n="c56-0116__main__7"/> which we wound, and which was <lb n="c56-0116__main__8"/> formed by the Arve whose course <lb n="c56-0116__main__9"/> we followed, closed upon us by degrees <lb n="c56-0116__main__10"/> and when the sun had set we <lb n="c56-0116__main__11"/> saw immense mountains &preci <lb n="c56-0116__main__12"/> pieces overhanging us on <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21465__Start"/> each <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21465__End"/> everyside <lb n="c56-0116__main__13"/> <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21473__Start"/> of us <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21473__End"/> & heard the sound of <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21476__Start"/> moun <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21476__End"/> the river raging <lb n="c56-0116__main__14"/> <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21482__Start"/> tain <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21482__End"/> <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21486__Start"/> streams <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21486__End"/> among rocks, and the dashing of the <lb n="c56-0116__main__15"/> waterfalls <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21494__Start"/> . <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21494__End"/> around. <milestone unit="tei:p"/> <lb n="c56-0116__main__16"/> The next day we pursued our <lb n="c56-0116__main__17"/> journey on mules and as we ascended <lb n="c56-0116__main__18"/> still higher; the valley assumed a <lb n="c56-0116__main__19"/> more beautiful & verdant appear <lb n="c56-0116__main__20"/> ance – Ruined castles ^ <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21524__Start"/> built <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21524__End"/> hanging on the precipices of piny mountains; <lb n="c56-0116__main__21"/> the impetuous Arve, and cottages every <lb n="c56-0116__main__22"/> here & there peeping from among the <lb n="c56-0116__main__23"/> trees, formed a scene of singular <lb n="c56-0116__main__24"/> beauty.. But it was augmented& <lb n="c56-0116__main__25"/> rendered sublime by the mighty <lb n="c56-0116__main__26"/> alps whose white & shining <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21552__Start"/> pir <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21552__End"/> <lb n="c56-0116__main__27"/> piramids & domes towered above <lb n="c56-0116__main__28"/> all like <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21560__Start"/> the <del loc="c56-0116__main__d1e21560__End"/> another earth —the <lb n="c56-0117__main__1"/> habitations of another race of beings <lb n="c56-0117__main__2"/> Soon <del loc="c56-0117__main__d1e21574__Start"/> e <del loc="c56-0117__main__d1e21574__End"/> after we entered the valley of <lb n="c56-0117__main__3"/> Chamounix. This valley is more beauti <lb n="c56-0117__main__4"/> ful <lb n="c56-0117__left_margin__1"/> <del loc="c56-0117__left_margin__d1e21591__Start"/> wondeful <del loc="c56-0117__left_margin__d1e21591__End"/> and sublime but not so beau <lb n="c56-0117__main__5"/> We passed the bridge of <del loc="c56-0117__main__d1e21601__Start"/> Pellisier <del loc="c56-0117__main__d1e21601__End"/> <lb n="c56-0117__main__6"/> Pellissier, where the ravine which the <lb n="c56-0117__main__7"/> river forms opened before us and <lb n="c56-0117__main__8"/> we began to ascend the mountain <lb n="c56-0117__main__9"/> which over hung it–. Soon after we <lb n="c56-0117__main__10"/> entered the Valley of Chamounix. This <lb n="c56-0117__main__11"/> valley is more wonderful and sublime <lb n="c56-0117__main__12"/> but not so beautiful & picturesque <lb n="c56-0117__main__13"/> as that of Servox; through which we <lb n="c56-0117__main__14"/> had just passed. The high & snowy <lb n="c56-0117__main__15"/> mountains w <del loc="c56-0117__main__d1e21626__Start"/> h <del loc="c56-0117__main__d1e21626__End"/> ere its boundaries <lb n="c56-0117__main__16"/> but <del loc="c56-0117__main__d1e21631__Start"/> t <del loc="c56-0117__main__d1e21631__End"/> we saw no more ruined castles <lb n="c56-0117__main__17"/> or fertile fields. Immense glaciers <lb n="c56-0117__main__18"/> approached the road, <del loc="c56-0117__main__d1e21639__Start"/> and <del loc="c56-0117__main__d1e21639__End"/> we heard <lb n="c56-0117__main__19"/> the rumbling thunder of the falling <lb n="c56-0117__main__20"/> Avelanche and marked the smoke <lb n="c56-0117__main__21"/> of its passage.–Mont Blanc, the beau <lb n="c56-0117__main__22"/> tifulsupreme & magnificent Mont Blanc raised itself from <lb n="c56-0117__main__23"/> the surrounding aiguilles and its tremen <lb n="c56-0117__main__24"/> dousdome overlooked the valley. <milestone unit="tei:p"/> <lb n="c56-0117__main__25"/> During this journey I sometimes joined <lb n="c56-0117__main__26"/> Elizabeth and exerted myself to point <lb n="c56-0117__main__27"/> out to her the various beauties of the <lb n="c56-0117__main__28"/> scene.— And often I <del loc="c56-0117__main__d1e21686__Start"/> let my <del loc="c56-0117__main__d1e21686__End"/> suffered <lb n="c56-0117__main__29"/> my mule to lag behind & indulged <lb n="c56-0118__main__1"/> in the misery of reflection. At other <lb n="c56-0118__main__2"/> times I spurred on <del loc="c56-0118__main__d1e21702__Start"/> my mule <del loc="c56-0118__main__d1e21702__End"/> the animal before <lb n="c56-0118__main__3"/> my companions that I might forget <lb n="c56-0118__main__4"/> them, the world, and more than <lb n="c56-0118__main__5"/> all myself. When at a distance I <lb n="c56-0118__main__6"/> alighted and threw myself on <lb n="c56-0118__main__7"/> the grass <del loc="c56-0118__main__d1e21724__Start"/> to shut out <del loc="c56-0118__main__d1e21724__End"/> weighed down <lb n="c56-0118__main__8"/> by horror & despair. At eight in <lb n="c56-0118__main__9"/> the evening we arrived at Chamou <lb n="c56-0118__main__10"/> nix. <del loc="c56-0118__main__d1e21740__Start"/> Myrtella <del loc="c56-0118__main__d1e21740__End"/> <del loc="c56-0118__main__d1e21743__Start"/> was <del loc="c56-0118__main__d1e21743__End"/> <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>My father & Elizabeth were very much fatigued. <lb n="c56-0118__main__11"/> <del loc="c56-0118__main__d1e21756__Start"/> a <del loc="c56-0118__main__d1e21756__End"/> Ernest who accompanied us was <lb n="c56-0118__main__12"/> delighted and in high spirits– The <lb n="c56-0118__main__13"/> only circumstance that detracted <lb n="c56-0118__main__14"/> from his pleasure was the south wind <lb n="c56-0118__main__15"/> and the rain that that wind seemed <lb n="c56-0118__main__16"/> to promise <del loc="c56-0118__main__d1e21770__Start"/> us <del loc="c56-0118__main__d1e21770__End"/> for the next day. <milestone unit="tei:p"/> <lb n="c56-0118__main__17"/> We retired early to our appartments <lb n="c56-0118__main__18"/> but not to sleep:– at least I did not. I <lb n="c56-0118__main__19"/> remained many hours at the window <lb n="c56-0118__main__20"/> watching the <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>pallid lightning that played <lb n="c56-0118__main__21"/> above Mont Blanc – and listening <lb n="c56-0118__main__22"/> to the rushing of the Arve which <lb n="c56-0118__main__23"/> ran before my window.
